title: Bolsonaro’s Arrest Exposes Limits to Trump’s Power
summary: President Trump tried to keep the former Brazilian president, Jair Bolsonaro, out of prison. He failed, and now he is moving on.

title: Billionaires Have a Bigger Role in Higher Education Under President Trump
summary: A new set of billionaires with an interest in higher education has helped oust college presidents and even assisted the Trump administration in its effort to overhaul the industry.

title: Trump Welcomes A.P.’s Photographers. Its Reporters? Not So Much.
summary: The White House now has conflicting approaches for Associated Press journalists as it fights the news service in court over access to presidential events.

title: U.S. and Ukraine Hail Progress on Peace Plan to End War With Russia
summary: Washington and Kyiv said that “highly productive” discussions over a proposal to end the war with Russia would continue. But details remained unclear.

title: Putin’s Win-Win: Take a Russia-Friendly Peace Deal, or Fight On
summary: The Kremlin’s leader is standing back as Ukraine and Europe scramble to negotiate changes to a U.S. proposal to end the war.

title: Russia’s Invasion of Ukraine Prompts Debate Over Europe’s Military
summary: With Russia looming, governments race to rebuild armed forces that shrank after the Cold War, grappling with hard issues of economics, politics and military strategy.

title: Why a Man With U.S. Ties Fought for Russia in Ukraine
summary: Col. Andrei Demurenko’s war story began at Fort Leavenworth, Kan., at a moment of hope and peace. It ended with a mortar blast in Ukraine.

title: An Auto Holy Grail: Motors That Don’t Rely on Chinese Rare Earths
summary: Weary of being captive to geopolitics, car companies are looking for ways to replace powerful rare-earth magnets in electric motors.

title: Why Crypto’s Slide Is Rattling Wall Street
summary: Bitcoin and other digital tokens have lost more than $1 trillion in value in recent weeks, raising concerns about a wider market fallout.

title: Our Staff’s Favorite Thanksgiving Recipes | Thanksgiving Recipes 2024 | NYT Cooking
summary: Reporters and editors shared the holiday dishes they love. Here are their recommendations for Thanksgiving side dishes, turkey and more.

title: Amid GPS and Ride-Hailing, the Allure of London’s Black Cab Endures
summary: In a world of GPS and car-hailing apps, some Londoners still want to drive a traditional black cab. First, they must memorize thousands of city streets.

title: Restrained, Beaten, Asphyxiated: New York Prison Guards’ Brutality Grows
summary: As frustrations among corrections officers mount, abusive treatment of inmates is rising and becoming more vicious, records and interviews show.

title: Why Are Guards Using Force More Often in New York’s Prisons?
summary: State prison guards say they are doing so because their jobs have become more dangerous. A New York Times analysis points to a different reality.

title: Health Issues in Middle Age Can Be Linked to Pregnancy Years Earlier
summary: Women with common pregnancy complications are at increased risk for cardiovascular and metabolic health problems later in life. But many patients remain unaware of the connection.

title: These Hospitals Figured Out How to Slash C-Section Rates
summary: Financial and social incentives can nudge doctors away from the operating room.

title: The Best Baseball Team Behind Bars
summary: The San Quentin Giants’ opponents are impressed. But what about the parole board that decides the players’ fate?

title: A Stand Against Coal Could Push Oakland Toward Bankruptcy
summary: After Oakland, Calif., reneged on a contract allowing coal shipments, a Kentucky company went under. Courts say the city must now pay hundreds of millions of dollars.

title: Jimmy Cliff, Singer Who Helped Bring Reggae to Global Audience, Dies at 81
summary: His Grammy-winning records as well as his starring role in the cult movie “The Harder They Come” in 1972 boosted a career spanning seven decades.

title: Jimmy Cliff: 8 Essential Songs
summary: A giant of Jamaican music, he gained international renown through the 1972 film “The Harder They Come,” and helped establish reggae’s themes of struggle, resistance and uplift.

title: They Loved Their Family Land in South Carolina. But Who Actually Owned It?
summary: Conservation can be tough when a property is passed down informally over generations. A growing effort is helping families sort it all out.

title: 5 Minutes That Will Make You Love Musicals
summary: Andrew Lloyd Webber, Sara Bareilles, Joshua Henry, Jeanine Tesori, Jason Robert Brown and New York Times writers and editors pick 13 songs to seal the deal.

title: America’s Caregivers Are in Crisis
summary: Caregivers are at the brink of despair.

title: James Carville: Out With Woke. In With Rage.
summary: Democrats also have to shed the last vestiges of woke.

title: Negotiating Peace in Ukraine
summary: We explain the Trump administration’s latest push to end the war.

title: Sleep Apnea Linked to Parkinson’s Disease, New Study Finds
summary: Those with the sleep condition were more likely to develop Parkinson’s disease. But one treatment was found to help.

title: Rick Cotton, Head of the Port Authority, Is Stepping Down
summary: Mr. Cotton oversaw the rebuilding of LaGuardia Airport and several other major infrastructure projects in the New York City region.

title: Grisly Killings of a Married Couple Spark New Sectarian Unrest in Syria
summary: The government acted quickly to tamp down reprisals in the central city of Homs as it tries to manage repeated waves of bloodshed involving minority groups.

title: Study Finds Mental Health Benefit to One-Week Social Media Break
summary: Young adults who engaged in a social media “detox” reported reductions in depression, anxiety and insomnia, though it was unclear how long the effects would last.
